definitions.definition: A place or institution where people are held against their will, in the US especially for long-term confinement, as of those convicted of serious crimes or otherwise considered undesirable by the government .
examples: The cold stone walls of the prison had stood for over a century.
Prison was a harrowing experience for him.

definitions.definition: Any restrictive environment, such as a harsh academy or home.
examples: The academy was a prison for many of its students because of its strict teachers.

main_definition: A place or institution where people are held against their will, in the US especially for long-term confinement, as of those convicted of serious crimes or otherwise considered undesirable by the government .
secondary_definitions: ( colloquial , figurative ) Any restrictive environment, such as a harsh academy or home.
